definition: to explore/to search out/to scout/to visit/to stretch forward

sentences.english: Friends have discreetly sounded out opinion on the diplomatic circuit on his behalf.
sentences.chinese: 朋友們謹慎地代表他探詢外交界的反應。

sentences.english: I inquired about the mechanism of these figures.
sentences.chinese: 我探詢這些形體的機理。

sentences.english: Because we are enquiring, exploring together.
sentences.chinese: 因爲，我們在一起探詢，探索。

sentences.english: Roll-call polling mechanism is considered for real-time control networks.
sentences.chinese: 輪叫探詢機制己被應用於實時控制網絡。

sentences.english: The man in the painting looked inquiringly at the Prime Minister.
sentences.chinese: 畫裏的人繼續探詢的看着總理。

sentences.english: In exploring whether warm mix is the wave of the future, we must address many questions.
sentences.chinese: 在探詢溫拌瀝青應用前景時，我們必須提出幾個問題。

sentences.english: It will calm your mind through meditation and self-questioning.
sentences.chinese: 通過冥想和自我探詢，將使你的頭腦感到清靜。

sentences.english: Really desperate you have to go, you tempted to pursue or explore.
sentences.chinese: 真讓你拚死也得去喫，誘惑你去追求或是探詢。

sentences.english: "And will he always keep his hand over his heart?" inquired Pearl.
sentences.chinese: “那他還會用手捂着心口嗎？”珠兒探詢着。

sentences.english: There are also online communities that allow you to share your dreams in forums for interpretation and discussion.
sentences.chinese: 你還可以在論壇上和別人討論探詢夢的解析。

sentences.english: But be discreet with your inquiries.
sentences.chinese: 不過在探詢消息時一定要謹慎。

definition: universally shocking/to offend the whole of society
to mention sth without elaborating (idiom); not giving details
lit. you hoodwink me and I cheat you (idiom); fig. mutual deception/each tries to outwit the other/dog eats dog and devil take the hindmost
lit. bashing sideways and colliding straight on (idiom); to push through shoving and bumping/to barge/to charge around violently
to trust one another fully/to treat sb with sincerity
to give a small demonstration of one's impressive skills (idiom)
both the guests and the hosts thoroughly enjoy themselves (idiom)
to make a show of being original or unconventional (idiom)
